Reviews.Title: “A very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: susanpradja
Reviews.Content: We got the flash deal from booking.com for EUR 180 for 3 nights at the very last minute, and we're really glad with this! At first, our taxi driver could not find this place since there are hundreds of hotels in Sultanahmet area. But if you already know the area, this place is not hard to find actually, simply take the tram (T1) to Camberlitas, cross the street, walk down until you find Piyer Loti Caddesi (with Pierre Lotti hotel in the corner) and you turn right, follow the street. At the end of the road, turn right again and you'll find this hotel. And it's about 5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, and Basilica Cistern. The room is very nice, clean and modern and has a free wifi.The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is not good though but there are many cafes and restaurants nearby anyway. And with the location in the middle of 2 tram station (Sultanahmet and Camberlitas), you could easily explore the city with the tram/metro. We had an early checked out so that we had to take taxi to the Ataturk airport which cost us only 45 Lira (EUR 19) and it's about 20 minutes ride.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAYNE R
Reviews.Content: first of all this hotel wonderful. I had gone istanbul for a short vacation.Ä± was looking for a hotel in a quiet but close to central locations.and then Ä± found this lovely hotel. my room was 504 in fifth floor.it was balcony and shower and I could see the spectacular views of the Marmara Sea.Hotel is so clean, comfortable ,modern and luxury also room price was affordable for me.You can have a breakfast in the restaurant also everything is fresh.I wanted have a breakfast at the roof but weather was rainy.There was a so attentive and informative gentleman in the reception called ersin. He has very nice smile.Thank you so much for friendship and best recommendations ersin.we will come back definitly.I recommend this hotel to everyone.shutlle service 25 euro athaturk airport(ps. there is a two airport in the istanbul.you must let inform them )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tapio J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and the service of the staff is excellent. They were friendly and helped us and fulfilled our hopes. Nothing was impossible - so we got the tickets for football with the help of Guven. It is rare to get service abroad with Finnish language - hyvÃ¤ Suomi :-) Breakfast was ok and the rooms were in good shape when we arrived back in the evening. Family from Finland

Reviews.Title: “cheerful and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: maxim k
Reviews.Content: My family and me stayed this hotel.We had lived so nice suprise when arrived to hotel.Because we booked for a standard room but.They gave to us corner suite room.it was most luxury room in the this hotel.we got so nice welcoming and all of them knowledgeable.especially reception.I think chief of reception can speak ten languages and also one of them cheerful and kind wich is speak russian we liked him.by the way buffet breakfast must be more various but service was good in additional they have roof and its overlook to the sea and amazing view and you can drink something there.if you decide to go there pls ask to them corner suit and they can arrange shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: stephenMilford
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul where I led a group and stayed at this hotel. The title speaks for itself. The hotel provides spacious and clean modern rooms. The staff at the hotel is friendly and helpful. Great location within easy walking distance of all the major sites in the Sultanahmet district. Tram is also easy accessible. Onlu possible drawback is the deep tub/shower which may become an issue for those with leg issues. Again a wonderful place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lee T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. The furnishing and the room was modern and clean. The quality that the hotel provided was definitely value for money. The staffs were able to converse in English and they were always willing to assist. I would definitely come back if I were to visit Istanbul again :):)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Manchesterscouser_12
Reviews.Content: From Ataturk Airport the hotel can be easily reached by metro & tram in less than 1 hour at a cost of 4 TL & then just a 5 minute walk downhill to the hotel. The hotel is in the Sultanahmet area & you can walk to all of the major attractions in 5-10 minutes. On arrival at the hotel I was greeted & made very welcome by a very kind & efficient young man on reception called Ersin. Nothing was too much trouble for Ersin & he made me feel very welcome offering me tea or coffee on arrival & providing me with as much information as I wanted. Ersin also helped me to print my boarding pass for my flight before leaving the hotel - (thank you Ersin)! I had a very nice room on the 5th floor which was very comfortable & quiet & everything worked fine in the room. Comfortable bed, great shower, modern wall mounted TV, free wifi.. The room was cleaned & serviced everyday to a high standard. Breakfast was adequate with sufficient choice, although during the winter the breakfast room was a little cold. The staff in the restaurant were very friendly and nothing was a trouble for them. I'm sure you will be very comfortable at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in an excellent location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Andythebrewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Recital Hotel. The reception was welcoming and friendly. The reception staff speak English pretty well- and it can be quite fun to have misunderstandings- patience is rewarded-please remember fellow english speakers, that the rest of the world is not obligated to speak our language perfectly . The lobby is just fine with comfortable chairs for waiting or working. Nicely decorated. We had a triple room on the first floor. The room was nice and clean(including the bathroom). The beds were clean and comfortable, the mattresses were on the firm side. Good sleep. The weather during our stay was exceptionately cold( 3C below at night, 2C in the day, snowy), but we were provided with a portable heater that was more than adequate to keep our room warm and comfortable. The shower was great and hot water plentiful. The TV was good with BBC News 24, Spanish TVE, NBC International, TV France 24 and Al Jazeera English among others. There is free WiFi in the lobby, and in the rooms. Just ask reception for the pass code for the WiFi service for your room.The buffet breakfast was fine, with a nice selection of food including cereal, cold meats, bread and rolls, boiled eggs, tomatoes, cucumber, yoghurt, coffee and tea. The fruit on offer, however, mostly looked past its best. All of the staff, cleaning ladies included, provided friendly service with a smile. There is also a terrace on the 5th floor. It does not give a view of the Sutanahmet district, but there is a decent view of the sea with all the ships passing by, or at anchor. The hotel is right in the Sultanahmet district. All of the main sights of the district are no more than a few minutes walk, or a short ride on the excellent tram away. A single cash fare is 2TL. You buy tram tokens at the machines near the entrance to the tram stops. The tram stop at Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ is 5 minutes from the hotel. From this stop you can get to Taksim Square in about 30 minutes (you also need to use the modern Funicular Train which is at the KabataÅŸ end of the tram line). Also, one stop down from Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ at the Sultanahmet stop, the Sultan Ahmet(Blue) Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, and Basilica Cistern are all with easy walking distance. The Grand Bazaar, which has 4,000 or 5,000 stalls depending on who you are talking to, is 10 minutes from the hotel. There is also a post office in the Grand Bazaar from where you can post your post cards. Post offices are few and far between. But you can buy stamps in gift shops. International postage for a post card is 2TL(Turkish Lira) The hotel offers a transfer service to Attaturk Airport. On Saturday February 18, 2012, it was 25 Euros one way for up to 3 people , and 5 Euros extra each, for additional passengers. We booked the hotel through Expedia and the deal included return airfare from London, A triple room with breakfast for 5 nights. The cost was Â£775. A good hotel at a good price. We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time in Recital Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Santo G
Reviews.Content: Me and my girl friend spent totally 5 days in Recital Hotel in January 2012. Generally speaking, they have 3 different kinds of rooms. Standard, deluxe and superior room. Initially we booked deluxe double room and at our arrival, because they were having availability, they upgrated our room to superior room, without paying any extra. So we stayed in the room 504, in the last floor, with beautiful balcony and Marmara sea view. The hotel is brand new, including the furnitures and the room is very very confortable and warm, equipped with all the facilities you can need, including free wireless. Also the bathroom is very big, clean and new. The furnitures style is a mix between classic and modern, but sure the match is perfect. Absolutely can be considered a 4 stars hotel. Moreover, the cleanliness personnel is well mannered and polite. Also the rest of the staff, including the people who is working in the reception and the restaurant, they are very polite, helpfull and they can speak a good english. After staying the first four days, we left the hotel to go to Cappadocia for 3 days. Because after Cappadocia we were spending last our night in Istanbul, we decided to stay with our pleasure at Recital Hotel. So we booked thru the web site our last night and we asked for transportation service from the airport to the hotel. Even if we stayed just for one night they give as the transportation, and as far as I know they give you the transportation if you book for at least 3 nights. Talking about the location, it is really amazing. You can reach by max 10 min walking all the important places in Sultanahmet, like Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, and the Metro Station Cemberlitas. To conclude my description, I absolutely reccomend and advice this hotel and Im sure that you will have a realy great time. Santo

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohannad A
Reviews.Content: I went with my beautiful family in July 2011. We made a previous booking by e-mail before our coming to Istanbul. It is about 45 minutes to reach this hotel from Ataturk airport. Not amazing lobby as shown in its web site photos of this hotel. Old fashion entrance. The location is perfect and nearest to Sultan Ahmet mosque (about 400m by walk). Many beautiful various restaurants and shops near this hotel. We stayed in the fifth floor. No internet service available in our floor. The service and staff is very good. They do not speaks English very well. They have tours to go around Istanbul, but its little expensive. We participated in 3 tours, only one (princesses Islands) was the best.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there”
Reviews.Author: NadiaOlteanu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, after reading many good reviews about this hotel. We went there and i realise it is a mistake by the entrance hall,,,old style and somehow dirty,,,looking negligent,,,anyway,,,we reach there at 15 pm and they were not having any room ready for us,.,they were saying that we must wait for 30 min for a clean room,,we insisted to give us a room, so they gave a terrible small room, without window! My boyfriend went to discuss with the receptionist about it,,and after he insisted, they offered a superior room, acceptable situated...the conditions were not too bad in the room, but the heat was not working properly and we have felt frozen that night,,,The worse moment was next morning, on breakfast,,,very poor,,,we were struggling to find something suitable to eat, but without succes...horrible coffee,,,nothing fresh,,,nothing sweet,,,not even a brioche,,,this is not acceptable in a 4 stars hotel, especially in Turkey,,We were irritated, especially because we have been before in Istanbul, in very nice hotels, cheaper and much much better than Recital,... So, the conclusion is that Recital is like 3 stars hotel, too expensive for what they offer,,and the breakfast is absolutely a disaster! We took our luggages after the first night and moved to Arden Hotel. We had a gourgeous treatment there, the rooms, the staff,,,the breakfast,,,we felt spoiled,,,they pampered us,,,and everything at the price of 55 euros, not 70 like in Recital's case! They even offered us a small present before leaving: a box with turkish delight! So,,,if you want a very nice hotel, go to Arden Hotel, you will simply love it! And i am giving you a nice tip for couples in love: go to have a romantic dinner to Panoramic Restaurant, it is situated right in front of Arden, on a roof. You will have a fantastic view of Ayasofia and Blue Mosque while you will take the dinner. Nadia -Bucharest, Romania

Reviews.Title: “A big dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Elle_01234
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing the overall good reviews and photos. I am sorry to say it was a big dissapointment. The service was very bad and slow. It was very difficult to communicate with any of the personnel as they didn't speak English adequately. All of the directions that we had from the reception on how to reach points of interest were always (!) wrong. We asked them to book a cruize for us and they (or the cruize agency, but that's not my problem- they should have checked) misled us by saying the cruize was canceled due to bad weather (but we went on our own just fine- the weather was great). At breakfast, dishes and cups were very-very dirty (breadcrums, hair, stains etc). Towels in our room were dirty and they didn't change it the first two days. The triple room that we had booked was in fact a twin room with a sofa bed fit only for children. However, we had e-mailed them (and called them on the phone) to confirm that there would be three single beds in the room and they said OK. What's more, that's what they show in their official pictures- 3 single beds for the triple room! Despite their mistake they didn't even offer us a discount or something complimentary... Finally, even though the hotel is very close to all main attractions, it seems that not even one taxi driver knows where the hotel is. As a result we circled round and about trying to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: atif a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great excellent location. 5min walk to the Bazarr, Blue Mosque, Topakia palace etc....The hotel was very clean and accomadated to every demand i had. Excellent breakfeast and view of the sea. Ersin who was our receptionist was excellent in recommending places to eat as well as attractions. I highly reccomend this spot cause it is safe and convienant to the bazaar which will lead you to carry multiple shopping bags when finished and close to drop them off to your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms & Mr Guven- a delight!”
Reviews.Author: kittycat2011
Reviews.Content: We had visited Istanbul in September and were a large group on a business trip, unfortunately we had to change the hotel at the nth hour because we had a celebrity amidst us and he had a preference. But i continued staying here along with a few from my group. I must say the rooms are lovely and unexpected ! The breakfast is really nice and most of all- the manager Mr. Guven is such a nice person. He really helped us out and did everything possible to help me cope with the pressure i was under at the time! He was knowledgeable, helpful, generous and kind. That was the first glimpse i had of the lovely people of turkey and i had such a nice time in this beautiful city. The lobby could do with an overhaul as it doesnt give you a sense of the beautiful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mac6471
Reviews.Content: Situated in an ideal location for the main sights and tram access. Rooms whilst lovely do have water pipe noises that kept us awake. We were moved to another room which helped but our bed's headboard rested against the wall which was was on the other side of next doors bathroom so you could hear their shower, bath and toilet being used when you were in bed. Room and bathroom was spoitless (as was all areas in the hotel) and you got fresh towels every day. Advisable to have beakfast early as if you leave it later as we did one morning there was hardly anything left and it wasn't replenished. Staff were helpful with room change and arranging airport transfer when our original booking for the airport failed to show. Overall a reasonable place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LOUISE P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. I stay in hotels all the time for work but it is a long time since I have stayed somewhere that accomodated my every need so well. The staff are extremely polite and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is NOT dangerous to access as the previous review states. It is in a brilliant location close to the tram stop, the grand bazaar, the blue mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The rooms are lovely. The decoration is very welcoming and cosy and the actual hotel walls are a good thickness so you don't hear much noise from within the hotel. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The road outside is much quieter than most in the city and the windows and patio doors are all double glazed. The bathrooms are new and very clean with big showers and lovely toiletries. Complimentary slippers and safe are in the room. Every time we sat in reception we were offered teas and coffees and on our day of departure we were due to leave before breakfast was served - the hotel staff organised something for us to eat before we left. They made the phone call to confirm our transport arrangements on our behalf, even though we chose not to use the hotel's own service. Overall, a brilliant hotel in a brilliant location and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Recital good hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: lyntn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Recital in Istanbul. It was very quiet, very clean and very close to most major attractions. The breakfast each morning was great and filling. The staff was courteous and very friendly. I recommend this hotel highly, It is new with wonderfully comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in old Istanbul and first-rate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jakage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Recital Hotel for five nights towards the end of August 2011. Everything was beyond our expectations and the proprietors and staff of the hotel really made our stay carefree - from the shuttle service from and to the airport, to the advice and help with booking tours and attractions and the unobtrusive and first-class service. Istanbul is a busy environment and the hotel is very conveniently placed a short walk away from all the main attractions of the old Istanbul - the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern to name a few. The hotel, however, offers an oasis of peace at night, or when needed during the day! The rooftop terrace has great views of the neighbourhood and further afield. This was definitely one of the accommodation highlights of our three and a half months travelling in Europe and Asia.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Recital Hotel for numerous reasons”
Reviews.Author: rkhairi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Recital Hotel Istanbul in the SultanAhmet District in August/September 2011. We had a wonderful experience there. The service was excellent. The hotel's location was amazing and within walking distance to all major touristic attractions. The hotel is new and super clean with great brakfast buffet with plenty of selections to choose from. The hotel staff were always ready with good restaurant recommendations and provided valuable advice thoughout our stay. We totally recommend Recital Hotel for a memorable and personalized experience. When in Istanbul, we will only stay there :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Chahira
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the staff...our stay was quiet comfortable...we simply felt like home,hope to stay there on my next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Marion V
Reviews.Content: Brand new, comfortable hotel at walking distance of all the major attractions. Yet it is in a fairly quiet street, so you can have a good sleep. Staff is very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessica w
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the recital hotel last week for our first trip to istanbul and this hotel was the perfect base. the location is perfect- a very short walk from the tram stop cemberlitas and very close to the bazaars and sultanahmet sites. the hotel itself is very clean and quiet and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. highly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: debra89
Reviews.Content: We found this delightful hotel on the doorstep of all tourist sites in the old city exceptionally quiet. There was a great selection of room types. The lovely atmosphere of Turkish hospitality from management through to staff assured comfort and relaxation during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to meet Istanbul like it is ment to be.”
Reviews.Author: Niker74
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and stuff is so pleasant that you want to stay at the hotel for a whole day. They were very helpful and the spending time there was really nice. For us, next time it will be the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed123
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Istanbul and we stayed at Recital Hotel. The hotel is a brand new one situated in Sultanahmet. The location of the hotel cannot be better, walking distance to most of the attractions (blue mosque, aya sophia, grand bazar, etc), and most importantly it was almost 3-4 minutes away from the tram which made is very convienient to move around the city. The staff (specifically the owners of the hotel) were of great help throughout our stay and all our demands were positively handled. Our room was spacious, breakfast was good (same everyday though) and the furtniture was all brand new. I think if they can improve their room service, they can become the best boutique hotel in Istanbul. I would surley recommend that you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: adrianamorice
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel but is sooo good,super nice,clean, the people that work there is amazing,super friendly and nice and will do everything to make u feel confortable,the rooms are very very nice and everything is clean and the service is just great, im deff gonna make this my hotel when i go to Turkey, cause is a great place!!! and plus is close everywhere,even to the Train !! i recommend it 100% !!!! Oh and the food is also amazing!!! i give it a 10 !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littlebluetricycle
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough good things about this beautiful hotel! The location is perfect - on a sidestreet, just few minutes' walk from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The building itself is exquisite. Our room had soft sheets, silk curtains, and a lovely, sizeable bathroom to wash away our travels when we arrived. Perfect! The staff are tremendously helpful, and ready to offer advice, or just a friendly cup of chay (tea). The entire building is incredibly restful. Someone (or lots of someones) have obviously put a huge amount of effort into getting the details right - and it shows. What else? Free wifi (hurrah!), aircon (double hurrah!) - oh, and it's scrupulously clean. We were delighted by the whole experience, and would happily have stayed longer (or return again). Enjoy!

HotelInfo.Name: Recital Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek Mahallesi Piyer Loti Caddesi, No: 21 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
